thread.title: ‘Not Worth Talking About’: Chuck Todd Briefly Addresses Milo Without Saying His Name
thread.title_full: ‘Not Worth Talking About’: Chuck Todd Briefly Addresses Milo Without Saying His Name

author: Josh Feldman
title: ‘Not Worth Talking About’: Chuck Todd Briefly Addresses Milo Without Saying His Name
text:
‘Not Worth Talking About’: Chuck Todd Briefly Addresses Milo Without Saying His Name by Josh Feldman | 7:05   Chuck Todd: "Free speech doesn't mean giving someone a free platform to spread hate or nonsense even if it does mean more clicks" #MTPDaily pic.twitter.com/4UaD5wPuOC 
— Meet the Press (@MeetThePress) February 21, 2017 
Milo Yiannopoulos ‘ resignation from Breitbart has gotten a lot of media coverage today, and on MSNBC Chuck Todd made the decision to briefly mention this controversy without even saying his name. 
Why? Because, as Todd argued, he’s “just not worth talking about.” 
He only took a minute to briefly address the news on his show, making it clear he didn’t want to devote time to covering someone “troll[ing] for attention.” 
“Free speech does not mean giving someone a free platform to spread hate or nonsense,” he said, “even it if does mean more clicks.” 
You can watch above, via MSNBC. 
[ image via screengrab ]
